section.title: Demonstration 1 Main Page

content.text: This demonstration covers a more complex fixed asset referencing example. It demonstrates a construction purchase order (PN) which has two different accounting lines (FC: PG413 and FC: PG511) but reference only one asset record. It demonstrates the following key concepts: How to reference real property fixed assets from multiple header accounting lines on a purchase order How to change asset accounting line amounts to ensure they total full amount of all purchase order accounting lines.
Demonstration 4 | Purchase Order with Multiple Header Accounting Lines to one Asset Record
Pegasys Fixed Assets

content.text: Here is the Header page for our order (PN). There is one Header Accounting Line for $100,000.
Click the Fixed Assets tab, so we can reference an asset.
The Fixed Assets page appears
Click the Add button
The Fixed Asset page appears
We'll enter the Asset Number that will have two Asset Accounting Lines.
And the Asset Type, CIPNEWCON.
Again, the Betterment Number is 0.
Select the Accounting Lines tab.
The Accounting Lines page appears
Click the Add button
The Accounting Line Number refers to the Header Accounting Line. There is only one Header Accounting Line on this order, so we enter 1.
Select the Accounting Lines link
Click the Add button to add the second of two Asset Accounting Lines.
Just like the other line the Accounting Line Number is 1 to refer to the only Header Accounting Line on the PN.
On this Asset Accounting Line, we will enter $25,000. That means that the total of our 2 Asset Accounting Lines will be $100,000 - the exact amount on the Header Accounting Line.
Select the top Fixed Assets link
To summarize, we have one fixed asset, with two Asset Accounting Lines whose total matches the amount on our single Header Accounting Line.
Select the Header tab.
Click the Save button
Click the Verify button.
If there are no errors, click the Submit button.
